intro: Oenothera cruciata, commonly known as the cross-leaved evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its distinctive cross-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that open in the evening. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Oenothera cruciata is part of the Onagraceae family and is known for its adaptability to various environmental conditions.
